recipes.name: Chicken Curry
recipes.ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces,1 onion, finely chopped,2 garlic cloves, minced,1 inch piece of ginger, grated,2 tomatoes, chopped,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste),Salt to taste,3 tablespoons vegetable oil,1 cup water,Chopped fresh cilantro for garnish
recipes.cooking_method: 1.Heat the oil in a large pan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. 2. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened and golden, about 5-6 minutes. 3.Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant. 4.Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned, stirring occasionally, about 5-7 minutes. 5. Add the chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Stir well to combine. 6. Pour in the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. 7.Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Samosa
recipes.ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,1/2 teaspoon salt,1/2 cup water3 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and diced into small pieces,1 onion, chopped,2-3 green chili peppers, chopped,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil
recipes.cooking_method: 1.To make the dough, mix together the flour, salt, and vegetable oil in a large mixing bowl. Gradually add the water and knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic. Cover the dough and set it aside to rest for 30 minutes. 2. To make the filling, heat the vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until it is translucent. 3. Add the diced potatoes and green chili peppers to the pan and stir well. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt to taste. Stir well to combine. 4.Cover the pan and let the potatoes cook until they are soft and tender, stirring occasionally. 5. Once the potatoes are cooked, remove the filling from the heat and let it cool completely. 6. To assemble the samosas, divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball out into a circle and cut it in half. 7. Take one half of the dough and shape it into a cone. Fill the cone with the potato filling and seal the edges by moistening them with a little water. 8. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling until all the samosas are filled. 9.Heat the vegetable oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Fry the samosas until they are golden brown and crispy. 10. Remove the samosas from the oil and drain them on a paper towel-lined plate. 11. Serve hot with tamarind chutney or mint-coriander chutney.

recipes.name: Ras Malai
recipes.ingredients: 1 liter of whole milk,1 tablespoon lemon juice,3 cups water,1 cup sugar, 8 Rasgullas (homemade or store-bought),  2 cups of milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom, 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as pistachios or almonds)
recipes.cooking_method: 1. To make the Rasgulla, bring the whole milk to a boil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Once it reaches a boil, turn off the heat and add the lemon juice. Stir well and let it sit for a few minutes until the milk curdles and the whey separates. 2. Strain the curdled milk through a cheesecloth-lined colander to separate the curds from the whey. Rinse the curds under cold running water to remove the lemony flavor. 3. Squeeze out the excess water and knead the curds for a few minutes until it forms a smooth dough. 4. Divide the dough into small balls and set them aside. 5. In a separate pot, add the water and sugar and bring it to a boil. Add the Rasgulla balls and cover the pot with a lid. 6. Let the Rasgullas cook in the syrup for 10-12 minutes until they double in size and become spongy. 7. Remove the Rasgullas from the syrup and set them aside. 8. To make the Ras Malai, add the milk and sugar to a separate pot and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let the milk simmer for 10-15 minutes until it thickens. 9. Add the cardamom and stir well. 10. Gently add the cooked Rasgullas to the milk mixture and let them soak for 30 minutes. 11. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve chilled.
